articles.author: Steven Scheer, Yomna Ehab
articles.description: Hezbollah rockets hit Israel's third-largest city of Haifa, police said early on Monday, and Israeli media reported 10 injured in the country's north on the first anniversary of the Gaza war, which has spread in the Middle East.
articles.title: Hezbollah strikes Israel on Gaza war anniversary; fears grow over Middle East instability

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris led Republican Donald Trump by a marginal three percentage points - 46% to 43% - as the two remain locked in a close race to win the Nov. 5 U.S. presidential election, according to a new Reuters/Ipsos poll.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris' lead over Trump narrows to 46% vs 43%, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Samira, a mother of two, yearns for her old life when she was an Arabic teacher and had a comfortable home - before the attack by Hamas on Israel a year ago plunged Gaza into suffering and chaos.
articles.title: Hamas faces dissent in Gaza as heavy toll weakens support for war, a year on

articles.author: Joseph Tanfani, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Pro-Trump officials' rise to prominence on local election boards raises the chances that they will be able to delay or sow doubt over the election, if Trump loses.
articles.title: Election officials who back Trump’s “Big Lie” stir concern in swing states

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lubana Ismail had just fled her village in southern Lebanon with her husband and two children when she went into labour. She had swollen veins in her uterus and needed immediate medical supervision to give birth safely.
articles.title: With hospitals full in Lebanon, family flees to give birth in Iraq

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hashem Safieddine, reported by Israel as apparently killed in its confrontation with Hezbollah, is widely seen as Hassan Nasrallah's likely successor as head of the Iran-backed group.
articles.title: Hashem Safieddine, the Nasrallah relative seen as future Hezbollah leader

articles.author: Huseyin Hayatsever, Daren Butler
articles.description: Turkey's lawmakers held a closed-door session on Tuesday to discuss the spread of war in the Middle East, a week after President Tayyip Erdogan made an unsubstantiated claim that Israel eventually aimed to encroach on Turkish territory.
articles.title: Turkish lawmakers discuss Mideast in closed session after Erdogan's Israel claim

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Southeast Asian leaders will meet in Laos this week as Myanmar's civil war and mounting tensions in the South China Sea risk corroding the ASEAN grouping's central role in the region.
articles.title: Myanmar and South China Sea to test ASEAN relevance in upcoming summit

articles.author: Sakshi Dayal, Rajesh Prabhuswamy
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) headed for a surprise election victory in Haryana state on Tuesday, reinforcing its popularity in the northern heartland a few months after stumbling in national elections.
articles.title: India's BJP set to win Haryana vote in boost for Modi, Congress rejects outcome

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine cannot win the war with Russia on the battlefield, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said on Tuesday, adding dialogue and a ceasefire were needed to save lives.
articles.title: Hungary PM Orban says Ukraine cannot win on the battlefield
